A Local Law in relation to the date of submission by the mayor of a preliminary management report and the date prior to which the council shall conduct public hearings and the date by which the council shall submit a report or reports pertaining thereto, the date of submission by the director of management and budget and the director of city planning of a draft ten-year capital strategy, the date of submission by the city planning commission of a report on the draft ten-year capital strategy, the date of submission by the mayor of the preliminary certificate regarding debt and reserves and appropriations and expenditures for capital projects, the date of submission by the mayor of the preliminary budget, the date of publication by the director of the independent budget office of a report on revenues and expenditures, the date of submission by the community boards of statements in regard to the preliminary budget, the date of submission by the commissioner of finance of an estimate of the assessed valuation of real property and statement of real property taxes due, expected to be received, and uncollected, the date of submission by the mayor of a tax benefit report, the date of submission by the borough boards of statements on budget priorities, the date of submission by the council of estimates of the financial needs of the council, the date of submission by the borough presidents of proposed modifications of the preliminary budget, the date of publication by the director of the independent budget office of a report analyzing the preliminary budget, and the date by which the council shall hold hearings and submit recommendations in regard to the preliminary budget, relating to the fiscal year two thousand four.
Items.MatterName: Submission dates of the preliminary budget.

Items.Title: Report of the Committee on Rules, Privileges, and Elections

Report of the Committee on Rules, Privileges and Elections re-confirming the appointment by the Council of VIRGINIA MICHELS DENT as a member of the Board of Directors of the New York City Soil and Water Conservation District.

The Committee on Rules, Privileges and Elections which was referred to on January 7, 2003, respectfully

REPORTS

Pursuant to section 6 of the New York State Soil and Water Conservation Districts Law, the Committee on Rules, Privileges and Elections, hereby approves the re-confirmation by the Council of VIRGINIA MICHELS DENT as a member of the Board of Directors of the New York City Soil and Water Conservation District to serve for the remainder of a three-year term that began on January 1, 2001, and expires on December  31, 2003.

Res. No. 657

RESOLUTION APPROVING THE RE-CONFIRMATION BY THE COUNCIL OF VIRGINIA MICHELS DENT AS A MEMBER OF THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS OF THE NEW YORK CITY SOIL AND WATER CONSERVATION DISTRICT

By Council Member Comrie

RESOLVED, that pursuant to section 6 of the New York State Soil and Water Conservation Districts Law, the Council does hereby re-confirm the appointment of  VIRGINIA MICHELS DENT as a member of the Board of Directors of the New York City Soil and Water Conservation District to serve for the remainder of a three-year term that began on January 1, 2001, and expires on December  31, 2003.
Items.MatterName: M 409 - Viriginia Dent, Soil & Water Conservation District Board of Directors

Items.Title:
Report of the Committee on Rules, Privileges and Elections confirming the appointment by the Council of JAMES HART as a member of the Board of Directors of the New York City Soil and Water Conservation District.

The Committee on Rules, Privileges and Elections which was referred to on January 7, 2003, respectfully

REPORTS

Pursuant to section 6 of the New York State Soil and Water Conservation Districts Law, the Committee on Rules, Privileges and Elections, hereby approves the confirmation by the Council of JAMES HART as a member of the Board of Directors of the New York City Soil and Water Conservation District to serve for the remainder of a three-year term that began on January 1, 2001, and expires on December  31, 2003.

Res. No. 658

RESOLUTION APPROVING THE CONFIRMATION BY THE COUNCIL OF JAMES HART AS A MEMBER OF THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS OF THE  NEW YORK CITY SOIL AND WATER CONSERVATION DISTRICT

By Council Member Comrie

RESOLVED, that pursuant to section 6 of the New York State Soil and Water Conservation Districts Law, the Council does hereby confirm the appointment of JAMES HART as a member of the Board of Directors of the New York City Soil and Water Conservation District to serve for the remainder of a three-year term that began on January 1, 2001, and expires on December  31, 2003.
Items.MatterName: M 410 - James Hart, Soil & Water Conservation District Board of Directors

Resolution calling upon the United States Congress to repeal the USA Patriot Act because of serious concerns regarding the federal government's increased powers of surveillance upon its citizens and the effects of this expanded power upon fundamental rights and liberties.
Items.MatterName: United States Congress to repeal the USA Patriot Act.

Items.MatterName: Truck routing sheets and maps depicting legal truck routes.

Items.MatterName: Examine the operations of payday loan programs.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the Mayor of the City of New York to submit a detailed accounting to the Metropolitan Transportation Authority of all costs and expenses incurred by the City in anticipation of a December 2002 transit shutdown and calling upon the Metropolitan Transportation Authority to make full payment of such costs and expenses to the City.
Items.MatterName: Submit a detailed accounting to the MTA of all costs and expenses incurred by the City in anticipation of a December 2002 transit shutdown .

Items.MatterName: Historical significance of 100 years of Korean immigration to the U.S.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the United States Congress to respect the authority of state and local elected officials to protect their constituents from predatory home loans that strip away hard-earned home equity, trap borrowers with excessive interest rates, and frequently cause families to lose their homes.
Items.MatterName: Protect constituents from predatory home loans that strip away hard-earned home equity.
